parse.title: List of elections in South Africa

text.*:
This article lists elections for legislative or quasi-legislative bodies in South Africa.

Contents

  • 1 Parliamentary general elections
    • 1.1 House of Assembly (1910–1984)
    • 1.2 Tricameral Parliament (1984–1994)
    • 1.3 National Assembly (1994–present)
  • 2 Referendums
  • 3 Municipal elections
  • 4 Bantustan elections
    • 4.1 Transkei
    • 4.2 Bophuthatswana
    • 4.3 Venda
    • 4.4 Ciskei
    • 4.5 Gazankulu
    • 4.6 KwaNdebele
    • 4.7 Lebowa
    • 4.8 QwaQwa
  • 5 Representative council elections
    • 5.1 Coloured Persons Representative Council
    • 5.2 South African Indian Council

Parliamentary general elections[edit]

House of Assembly (1910–1984)[edit]

  • 15 September 1910
  • 20 October 1915
  • 20 March 1920
  • 8 February 1921
  • 19 June 1924
  • 14 June 1929
  • 17 May 1933
  • 18 May 1938
  • 17 July 1943
  • 26 May 1948
  • 15 April 1953
  • 16 April 1958
  • 8 October 1961
  • 30 March 1966
  • 22 April 1970
  • 24 April 1974
  • 30 November 1977
  • 29 April 1981

Tricameral Parliament (1984–1994)[edit]

  • 22 and 28 August 1984 (House of Representatives and House of Delegates)
  • 6 May 1987 (House of Assembly)
  • 6 September 1989 (all houses)

National Assembly (1994–present)[edit]

  • 26–29 April 1994
  • 2 June 1999
  • 14 April 2004
  • 22 April 2009
  • 7 May 2014

Referendums[edit]

  • Natal Union referendum, 10 June 1909
  • Republic referendum, 5 October 1960
  • Constitutional reform referendum, 2 November 1983
  • Negotiated reform referendum, 17 March 1992

Municipal elections[edit]

  • 1 November 1995 (delayed to 29 May 1996 in the Western Cape and 26 June 1996 in KwaZulu-Natal)
  • 5 December 2000
  • 1 March 2006
  • 18 May 2011
  • 3 August 2016

Bantustan elections[edit]

Transkei[edit]

  • 20 November 1963
  • 23 October 1968
  • 24 October 1973
  • 29 September 1976
  • 24 September 1981
  • September 1986

Bophuthatswana[edit]

  • 4 October 1972
  • 22–24 August 1977
  • October 1982
  • 27 October 1987

Venda[edit]

  • 15–16 August 1973
  • 5–6 July 1978
  • July 1984

Ciskei[edit]

  • 19–23 February 1973
  • 18–22 June 1978
  • Independence referendum, 4 December 1980
  • September 1986

Gazankulu[edit]

  • 16–17 October 1973
  • 13 September 1978
  • 7 September 1983
  • 25 January 1989

KwaNdebele[edit]

  • 8–10 December 1988

Lebowa[edit]

  • 11 April 1973
  • 15 March 1978
  • 16 March 1983

QwaQwa[edit]

  • 19–21 March 1975
  • 19–21 April 1980
  • 1985
  • 1990

Representative council elections[edit]

Coloured Persons Representative Council[edit]

  • 30 September 1969
  • 19 March 1975

South African Indian Council[edit]

  • 4 November 1981
